content: Well designed app, worth paying for. But please please please include the "choose renderer" feature that VLC now has. Essential for people streaming music and video to Chromecast devices around the house.
Perfect
Fantastic app paid for the pro version, connected with my pc no problem. Wouldnt be without it now. I highly recommend this app üëç
This is a great app. Thank you!
Excellent. Does require technical skill and time to set up. And then it works well.
Fantastic. Very useful. Don't have to use the mouse!
A feature I'd be very interested in (I have already purchased) would be for a repeat A/B function for audio tracks.
perfect and tto the point

So far it has worked great. It was worth it for me to pay for the unlocked version. The UI is well designed an intuitive, and has functioned perfectly. It's the final step I've needed to make a complete standalone media player. Thank you! Update 14 Oct 2020: Very happy with this app after using it for some time. Haven't run into a single problem. My home theatre viewing during this pandemic would be noticably more frustrating without it. I bought a tablet to dedicate to this and volumio
Good UX, never crashes, easy set up and great value!

I wish more apps were this elegantly simple. I was looking for an app to control VLC on my media PC and that's exactly what this does, and it does it better than I ever could have imagined! Being able to browse my media from my phone is a really great feature. This app is almost perfect! The one and only feature I would like to see if the ability to change the color scheme since I've never been a big fan of VLC orange. Worth every penny and I'd highly recommend it to anyone.
Works well. Depending on the phone it can be difficult to edit computer settings once added

After trying out several, I settled and bought the licence for this one. It has all the features I need, including adding youtube to my playlist, and adding my computer manually . My SOLE reservation is that once I connect, and can add songs to the pc playlist, they dont show up on the android side until I restart the application. That sad, it does show up. After experimenting with half a dozen or more VLS remotes I find this one to best meet my needs and expectations.
Works perfectly, and does more than I expected. A well-coded, ad-free, pleasant experience.
Needs chapter navigation

I sit myself a couple of metres from my PC and control VLC remotely with this app. I can now pause or rewind a scene without disturbing Pringles crumbles on my chest. 5 star and a salute to the dev. I've been using this app for more than a year and it's my companion at watching movies. Thank you, Rob the developer man
üëçüëçüëç

Works as advertised, but cannot install paid version on more than one android phone/tablet. Results in "already installed" but charges me twice anyway. Also, it requires VLC to be running, that's fine, but could you get the PC app to run VLC manually if not already running?

Been using this app for a few years now on both, iOS and Android. I've been very pleased and satisfied with the fact that I can control watching media from my laptop which is displayed on my TV, while in the comfort of my bed!
It works, enough said. Handy to have with me while listening to podcasts on Bluetooth headphones.
Works like a charm to control VLC on my Mac media server.
works better than the other paid vlc remote I just bought then found this
Excellent app. File browsing is especially great

I love this remote for VLC, easy to set up and very complete. Misses only the option to change playlist items order. There is an option I don't get: transparent or black widget, but the app does not come with a widget (on Nexus 7 and Galaxy S6 it is not in the widgets list) and I don't see any difference when I change the option.
perfect!
super
Needs an update. Great app tbo.
It does everything as promised. The only thing I am missing is option of moving the songs order in the playlist. Would love to see this option in the future updates.
Great app! Wish the lockscreen widget had volume though...
replyContent: Hi Brian, we do have a widget! You should be able to find it in the widgets section of the app-launcher. Drop us an email if you can't find it and we'll be happy to help.

content: finally a remote control that works
Easy to use. Just works...
Very nice as usual from these folks!
Works well but needs some further refinement
Great app works well!

A brilliant App if you use VLC Media Player to play music from a PC through a DAC / Stereo Amp to speakers in a different room. Does exactly everything I want in controlling playback / track selection / shuffle control etc.. Brilliant!

Pretty much everything you could want, from a basic level. It would be nice if more VLC settings were accessible through the app. But it's possible that there is a good reason those aren't or can't be implemented. Either way it's a great app and a must-have for anyone who watches videos through VLC on their TV.
Much better in ios than android, the very same app, from same coder.

Does exactly what it says on the tin, nothing more nothing less and it does it to perfection (mobile side) however sometimes the helper app on PC does not always set up correctly first time. Not worth losing a star for though!
Good app, would add another star of they would invest in updating the design to make it for pleasing to look at. Using VLC mobile for now.

DVD navigation controls shows up in playlist for some reason. Really 
annoying. But a great program over all. Replaced Gmote for me.
It's not accurate and very slow when using Android phone.
Yippee! Back from the dead. Now I can install it in my new device. Thanks!

Need option to remove the enable wifi message. App works without wifi if

Install error certification sign

Love the app .. still .. :) Still giving it 5 stars even though the playlist management has deteriorated! Please make removal of items on playlist easier by allowing multiple selects?

Super great! If you are a fan of Vlc this is a must have! You can browse your entire computer and create Playlists. Format is incredibly clean. I would pay up to 10 bucks for it. But it is priced well
It works well....inability to hide/supress the DVD controls is a bit bothersome but overall works as advertised.
This app is perfect works flawlessly and is used for controlling a headless music system. Been using for a few weeks now with no issues at all,just what I was looking for
Stopped working after all these years
Great app.  Great feature list. Does what it promises and is pretty user friendly.
Used it for months. It's part of my daily routine. Easy to use and setup. Works flawlessly on my lg k20.
Great stuff.
Does what it says on the tin
Very handy app for the very lazy like myself.

This app is great for watching your movies and tv shows from the comfort of your couch! It lets you add videos to your playlist from your phone, play, pause, move ahead or backwards and even enable/disable subtitles!
Awesome app. Early on the dev also improved it after my friend made suggestions. Great support and does as intended

Very good although my phone seems to keep forgetting that my computer exists so I have to keep deleting the 'old' one and setting my PC as a 'new' one. Could be me, could be the app, could be my wifi set up or a glitch in the matrix...
This is a great application. gives me the ability to browse everything from my computer
Should have a way to enter the app from the notifications
Great app. Only feature I need would be the ability to hardware volume control outside of the app.
Doesn't read all the stuff in one list

Excellent paid app. Worth every penny. Full control of VLC as well as network drive access. The only request for improvement is to have the pull down menu controller allow you to open the app when tapping the title.

Pretty good app for the most part. There are some things that i wish it would have, a couple of them being the ability to control brightness and video other video settings, and being able to start the App instead of having to manually start the app on the computer and then walk to my couch.
Great app. I love it. Although, at times, it does stop working or won't connect. But when it does, a reset usually fixes things.

real quality work done by the hobbyist. i appreciate the response to emails on feedback! please bring android up to par with iphone especially for paid users. it would be most welcomed and i think deserved for people paying for the product cheerz!

Works as promised. What more can you ask for these days?  In all seriousness though, it's a solid app. Stable, intuitive, and competitively priced. Nice job folks. I usually don't give 5 star ratings, but you deserve it.
Great app, really great app if you want to control your VLC player from your couch

content: Amazing a++

always having issues with this app. always running the connection wizard. plug and play dude.

I think this app is good enough to impress the president
1st app I have paid for
Extremely well made app with easy to follow instructions. Very easy to set up and use.
Best thing to ever happen to a porn collection. ;D

It took some doing to get the free version to see my VLC (I had to specify the IP address for my laptop) but it works so well now I bought the upgrade. Now when I watch MLB.TV via mlbviewer and VLC I can easily stop and restart the feed, and make it full screen again all without touching my mouse or trackpad. Plus I got the closed captions working! This app is so worth the price.
The favorites folders don't work, fix please. Now work well. Thanks!

Personally I am still biased toward the old layout/design, however it must be said that the app does what its supposed to without any problems. I do wish the "position and volume" and "DVD navigation" had there own screen, like the original layout, but that's just a personal gripe, overall the app works well.
This app is definitely worth paying for. It was simple to set up on my Linux box. It's great being able to browse the .flacs I've made from my 900+ CD collection so easily.

Absolutely fantastic - just like everything VLC has done!  I've been using their player for PC for years and there's nothing else that comes close - it'll chew up anything you throw at it with ease and has an incredible amount of functionality.  This remote makes for a wonderful easy life - exceptionally easy to set up and use (took me under 2 mins from start to finish) and fun to play around with.  Great work chaps!

Love the call monitoring! Invaluable and a must have if your chained to your phone and have to answer your phone.... otherwise, turn your phone off and enjoy the movie with another APP that has built in mouse function.  Bottom line is that if you add built in Wi-Fi mouse function it would be a 5-star rating. Also, the old version used to auto-connect when launched and took 3 seconds for total control.... the newer versions require twice the time and you have to select even if you only have one computer????

When it works it's great. I've had to redo the setup twice now. This time it will not work no matter what I do. I'm guessing this has something to do with the update. Not being blocked by firewall. I even uploaded the vlc setup helper and did all that ridiculousness and still doesn't work. It worked fine before if a little glitch. Now it's useless. Thanks guys
I've tried just about every remote app on play store and this is app is top dog! Love the UI, love the UX! Great job
Use it to control VLC on my media computer as a remote, works great!

I wish Netflix had something like this. Or anything else really. This app is so fantastic and does what it's supposed to. The paid version to be able to browse files is so worth it. Only annoying part is i have a really annoying notification from it that won't go away.
Thank you, great job. Have been using it for years

Of all the apps I own, I use this one more than any other by far.  The support is great, the price is great, so simple a child could implement it, and they are constantly listening to user feedback and updating the app to reflect those opinions.  It was worth every penny, and I would have paid more.
I rarely give 5 stars for anything but this is just great. Very stable and smooth. I use vlc a lot so having this remote app makes my life much easier.
Works perfectly
It works
Works perfectly, and has some awesome features like "find in IMDB." One bummer is you can't change audio devices. But otherwise perfect.
Seriously just made my life so much more convenient.
Good app, which does what it says on the tin. 5* rating is due to a responsive developer too!
Bring back the scrolling by seconds! You can't scroll using this small bar!! No it is not back.

content: I didn't figure out that LUA password and interface has to be activated in VLC. Thanks to the developer for his support, now all is back to work!

replyContent:
Hi Jan,
there are some issues with the new version, and we're working on fixing them. 
The volume dials will return, and the tap area on the 'play folder' will enlarge. (It currently works, but it has a ridiculously small tap area). Please bear with us...

content: Play mkv files? Hate to get up and mess with the computer when trying to relax on couch? Want to use your phone as a remote while you browse and control play back? This is for you. I use a mini mac connected to my flat screen with this app as my remote. The directions are straight forward and the developer actually gets back to you.
Get into that computer sideways with this app. Used it for years. Fewer problems than benefits. Worth more than they are asking.

content: Works beautifully. So easy to set up! This is going to be so useful for watching videos on my dual-screened TV without having to control everything from the computer 30 feet away. The changes look nice as well. Definitely better functionality.

content: The new version is just great! And having the player show up on the lock screen, been wanting that for a while. Thanks.
I like the rebuild. Looks great. Is faster. A TV record would be nice. Thank-you hobbyist team.

content: Constantly having to reconnect to my laptop, sometimes if fails to reconnect, more trouble than its worth. VLC works well with the iphone app, shame the Android app isn't as reliable.
Its pretty much the best VLC remote ive ever used...the downside is that the UI feels a bit cluttered. All in all though still a great app.
It was super easy to get installed. Only took a few minutes. All of the features work well for me.

I enjoy using this app a little more than the actual interface for VLC sometimes.  It's just so convenient. I use my living room TV as an extra display for my bedroom desktop... And well.. Being able to control vlc so effectively is like having access to any media I want! Beautiful!

Super responsive developer with a terrific app. I purchased this a while ago, without hesitation, and would happily make the same decision again!

I would have given 5 stars, if it would have persistent connection to my vlc player. It keeps telling me that there is no detectable vlc player running on my computer, but isn't so in reality. I have to turn off the WiFi of my computer and again connect it, to solve the problem. It's really annoying.

I use it with Linux (Ubuntu and Mint on another machine), works great. Took me a while to get set up, tech support was quick and very helpful. Once it was configured (more to do with the computer than the app) it worked like a charm. Definitely recommend, I'd tried almost a dozen different remotes and this is by far the best and most stable.
Great app

I really like this app, and it was worth what I paid. As other users have said, there are a few bugs with it, such as the connection not being persistent, although it would drain battery if it were, maybe something for the devs to look at, and file management could be a bit smoother, like being able to add whole folders to a playlist instead of each episode. Other than that, it's made my hard drive video collection a lot more comfy to use, great job!

Downloaded the free app first, but saw File Browsing not included. Bought the app and Im really impressed. User friendly, easy to understand after playing around for a while. Auto Config also a plus. Spent the whole weekend watching movies and using this app. Great! Only issue is you have to have an instance of vlc open on your laptop or pc before you can connect the remote.

Not sure what happened. It worked for a long time and all of a sudden want connect any more. Tried a full reinstall, reverted to old version, connection is fine in a browser and in other apps but this one just in seeing anything to connect to any more. No clue. Hoping and update will fix it.

Hi,
If so, you'll find the 'connection help' button on the helper.

(my email is in the settings tab)

Functionally amazing, but the UI looks like a really poor iPhone port... Needs a holo UI refresh.. Not just for looks but ease of use... For example ActionBar would be super useful

Does exactly what it's advertised to do. Been using it for a while now without a single glitch. Thanx.

this app is just incredible. It works perfectly fine and flawlessly. The best 4 dollars I spent for a long time.The help files and descriptions are really helpful. Thanks guys.

content: Great features, very responsive, setup wizard and troubleshooting support are easy and comprehensive.

This app is pretty much the ultimate app for lazy people as it allows you to pretty thoroughly control VLC using only your mobile device.  The only downside to it is that you have to be connected to a wireless network in order to use it (both your device and the computer/ laptop need to be connected to the same network in order to use it)  Once the connection is made, and you have an instance of VLC running on your computer/laptop then you can use the app to load a file, and then have full control of it.  In short: This is the ultimate app for people who like to watch video/ listen to music on their laptop whilst not near it as it allows for simple, effective control.
I use this daily. I rarely have any software hiccups. It's nice to start music from the car when I get near my wifi.
Setting it up couldn't be easier with the provided host config utility, and it does everything you'd hope. Terrific job.
I control vlc from bed...pipes your music for me :)

Completely satisfied

Looks like it has some good features, which is why I bought it - but it's pretty clunky.  Also, VLC seems to interrupt & stream choppily when this app is running.  That doesn't happen with the free version or when I remote from a browser.  May be solvable - some sort of remote control/contention problem - can't figure it out & with the free version, i don't have to.

I can go into my files on my externals and pick what i want. So now I'm laying outside in the sun on the trampoline feeling very smug.

This is where my other purchased media players fall over. None of them (even wd live) can properly and flawlessly play media without some kind of issue requiring my attention.  Vlc plays everything beautifully every time. And this remote accurately allows me to do all the things I want with Vlc. Trouble free.

content: Nos primeiros minutos de uso da vers√£o demo do programa, j√° me conquistou. Simplesmente perfeito.

After a lot of struggling with the set-up I'm now fairly impressed with this app. It took me over 30 mins configuring things before I could link my Android and PC - and then 'keep' the connection - but it was worth the effort. I ended up having to do the advanced set-up, entering the IP address manually as it kept 'forgetting' the PC using the standard set-up. Also, I was originally running the latest VLC Portable version, but quickly realised that VLC Remote wouldn't work with it so I had to install the 'proper' version - VLC Remote gives you a download link for this.  Once VLC Remote is running the interface feels rather confusing, and it takes a fair amount of trial and error before it feels comfortable, but it is worth the effort getting familiar with it.  I keep all my videos on an external hard drive, and accessing this is easy once you've worked out the file tree - I've added the Video folder to the 'favourites' list for easy access. As some of my videos are 'split' within 'DVD style' folders I needed to set VLC Remote to play from 'folders' rather than 'files' - again, it's easy to select this option from the menu.   In summary, it's a great app but tricky to configure.
Setup helper worked a treat and this is an awesome app!
Couldn't make it work with Windows VLC without manual entry. Finds computer but then fails to connect. UI is atrocious.
Works great and installation was very easy with vlc setup helper!!
Utter genius app.  Picks up every single share, file etc. don't need to get up Works like a charm
PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE add remote start VLC player. That will make this app totally complete!! I guess it ain't that easy a task since it is requested a lot and has been from early on.
Please implement the ICS menu please and this app is not showing up in recent apps.
I can completely control my htpc viewing with this app. Love it. No more fumbling for a remote or mouse.
Great app for controlling VLC while not at PC. Scrolling through folders is a bit choppy but otherwise great app.

This is great for controlling my VLC player on my desktop.  It comes with easy to use tools to connect your device to your desktop, and it can do everything from browsing files to play, add to play list, index control (!!!), volume control, subtitle settings, etc.  It's perfect.

This app typically works perfectly, if ur able to overlook the volume adjust delay crap. But the real problem I found lies with which version of VLC you have installed on your computer. Anything before 2.0.0 seems to run perfectly, but versions 2.0.0 and gives you the "NO SIGN OF VLC etc" error message, even after a successful pairing with the VLC Remote App. It's really weird, but I had to go back to version 1.1.9 of VLC on my computer, because that was the last version I had that worked perfectly. It might just be me, cuz my luck with anything techie related is terrible, but if you find yourself running into similar problems with the 2.0.0+ versions of VLC (on your computer), downgrade to 1.1.9
replyContent: Hi, we definitely do support VLC 2.x and above, so if you you're still having problems, please send us an email and we'll be happy to help sort it out.

A great little app. A couple of quid means I don't have to get off the sofa and the missus doesn't have to put up with the  laptop on the floor next to the telly. I can now run everything off the family server under the stairs. A breeze to set up too.

replyContent: Hi, you can definitely open music playlists. Assuming they are saved as m3u8 files, just select them in the normal browse window and press play.

content: Why on earth do you need to read my phone's identity? Reading in the permission, I saw you'd be able to read who calls me and whom I call. Does that sound right to you?
replyContent: Hi. I think the permission is 'Read phone status and identity'. This allows us to know when you get a call, and pause VLC automatically. We certainly don't look at who you are calling, or who calls you. I hope that puts your mind at rest, but do email us if you'd like more info.

replyContent: HI, I'm afraid this is the way that VLC is designed. VLC are working on a more secure system for VLC 2.1, but we can't use that until it is released.
